title: Exodus Chapter 26 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Exodus chapter 26 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Exodus Chapter 26 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Exodus Chapter 26.

questions.question: How many curtains of fine twined linen were to be made for the tabernacle?
options: Five
Ten
Eleven
Twenty
questions.correctAnswer: Ten
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:1 states that the tabernacle was to be made with ten curtains of fine twined linen.

questions.question: What colors were the curtains of fine twined linen made with?
options: Blue, green, and white
Blue, purple, and scarlet
Red, white, and blue
Purple, gold, and silver
questions.correctAnswer: Blue, purple, and scarlet
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:1 specifies the curtains were made with blue, purple, and scarlet colors.

questions.question: How long was one curtain of the fine twined linen?
options: Twenty cubits
Eight and twenty cubits
Thirty cubits
Four cubits
questions.correctAnswer: Eight and twenty cubits
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:2 states the length of one curtain was eight and twenty cubits.

questions.question: How many loops were made on the edge of one curtain for coupling?
options: One hundred
Twenty
Fifty
Ten
questions.correctAnswer: Fifty
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:5 states fifty loops were made on the edge of one curtain.

questions.question: What were the curtains coupled together with?
options: Gold taches
Silver hooks
Brass rings
Copper nails
questions.correctAnswer: Gold taches
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:6 commands making fifty taches of gold to couple the curtains together.

questions.question: How many curtains of goats' hair were made as a covering upon the tabernacle?
options: Ten
Eleven
Five
Six
questions.correctAnswer: Eleven
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:7 says eleven curtains of goats' hair were to be made for covering.

questions.question: What was the length of one goats' hair curtain?
options: Twenty cubits
Thirty cubits
Eight and twenty cubits
Four cubits
questions.correctAnswer: Thirty cubits
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:8 describes each goats' hair curtain as thirty cubits long.

questions.question: How many boards were made on the south side of the tabernacle?
options: Twenty
Six
Ten
Forty
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:18 specifies twenty boards on the south side.

questions.question: What material were the boards for the tabernacle made of?
options: Cedar wood
Oak wood
Shittim wood
Acacia wood
questions.correctAnswer: Shittim wood
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:15 states that the boards were made of shittim wood.

questions.question: How many sockets of silver were made for the twenty boards on the south side?
options: Twenty
Forty
Ten
Fifty
questions.correctAnswer: Forty
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:19 notes forty sockets of silver for the twenty boards, two sockets per board.

questions.question: True or False: The middle bar in the midst of the boards reaches from end to end.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:28 states that the middle bar shall reach from end to end.

questions.question: True or False: The vail was made of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen with cherubims.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:31 describes the vail as made of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen with cherubims.

questions.question: True or False: The door hanging of the tent was made with needlework of goats' hair.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:36 states the door hanging was made of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen with needlework, not goats' hair.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And thou shalt make boards for the tabernacle of ______ wood standing up.'
options: cedar
oak
shittim
pine
questions.correctAnswer: shittim
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:15 clearly states the boards were made of shittim wood.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'And thou shalt make a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed ______, and a covering above of badgers' skins.'
options: red
blue
purple
white
questions.correctAnswer: red
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:14 specifies the covering was made of rams' skins dyed red.

medium.title: Exodus Chapter 26 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Exodus Chapter 26 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with maintaining unity in their church community. Based on Exodus 26, what biblical truth would you share about unity and cooperation?
options: Unity requires careful joining and binding together, as the curtains were coupled with loops and taches to form one tabernacle.
Unity means everyone does their own thing independently without connection.
Unity is only about agreeing on minor issues, not major ones.
Unity is achieved by avoiding difficult conversations.
questions.correctAnswer: Unity requires careful joining and binding together, as the curtains were coupled with loops and taches to form one tabernacle.
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:3-6 describes how the curtains were coupled together by loops and gold taches to form one tabernacle, teaching us the importance of intentional unity and cooperation in the body of Christ.

questions.question: How does Exodus 26 teach us about faithfulness and obedience in following God's instructions?
options: By emphasizing precise measurements and materials in building the tabernacle, showing the importance of faithful obedience to God's commands.
By allowing builders to change details as they wish for convenience.
By focusing only on the general idea of the tabernacle, ignoring specifics.
By encouraging improvisation and personal preference in worship.
questions.correctAnswer: By emphasizing precise measurements and materials in building the tabernacle, showing the importance of faithful obedience to God's commands.
questions.explanation: Verses like Exodus 26:2, 8, 16-17 highlight exact measurements and materials, demonstrating how God values thorough obedience and faithfulness in following His Word.

questions.question: A believer is feeling discouraged about their service in the church, thinking their efforts are unnoticed. What can Exodus 26 teach about the value of every part in the body of Christ?
options: Every part is essential, like each curtain, board, and socket in the tabernacle that together make one complete dwelling.
Only the leaders and prominent members are important.
Service is optional and not necessary for the church's function.
God only values the most visible acts of service.
questions.correctAnswer: Every part is essential, like each curtain, board, and socket in the tabernacle that together make one complete dwelling.
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:7-25 details how every curtain, board, and socket has a specific role, teaching that all members' contributions are vital in God's house.

questions.question: How does the detailed construction of the tabernacle in Exodus 26 encourage a diligent work ethic in believers?
options: By showing that careful, skilled, and honest work honors God, as seen in the intricate curtains and gold overlay.
By promoting laziness since God will do everything for us.
By encouraging shortcuts to finish work faster.
By suggesting work quality is unimportant as long as the job is done.
questions.correctAnswer: By showing that careful, skilled, and honest work honors God, as seen in the intricate curtains and gold overlay.
questions.explanation: Verses such as Exodus 26:1, 29 describe the craftsmanship and gold overlay, teaching that our work should be done with excellence and integrity as an act of worship.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to become prideful about their spiritual achievements. According to Exodus 26, what perspective can help foster humility?
options: Recognizing that the tabernacle’s beauty and function depended on many parts working together, not on one alone.
Believing that personal achievements are the only important factor.
Thinking that only the most visible parts deserve honor.
Ignoring the contributions of others.
questions.correctAnswer: Recognizing that the tabernacle’s beauty and function depended on many parts working together, not on one alone.
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:25-28 shows how multiple boards and bars must be connected for strength, encouraging humility by valuing teamwork and dependence on others.

questions.question: How does the covering of the tabernacle with rams' skins dyed red and badgers' skins (Exodus 26:14) teach about the protective grace of God in trials?
options: It symbolizes God's covering and protection over His people amid difficulties and spiritual battles.
It only refers to physical shelter with no spiritual meaning.
It suggests we must rely on ourselves alone for protection.
It teaches that coverings are unnecessary.
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes God's covering and protection over His people amid difficulties and spiritual battles.
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:14 speaks of layered coverings, reminding believers of God's gracious protection over us when facing trials and temptations.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 26, the tabernacle’s design was given so that believers might understand the importance of reverence and separation between God and man.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:31-33 describes the vail dividing the holy place from the most holy, teaching reverence and separation to approach God rightly.

questions.question: True or False: The detailed instructions in Exodus 26 suggest that God values order and discipline in the life of His people.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The precise measurements and careful assembly in Exodus 26:2-29 demonstrate God's desire for order and discipline as part of faithful service.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with forgiveness and reconciliation. How might the instruction about the mercy seat on the ark (Exodus 26:34) encourage them?
options: The mercy seat represents God’s forgiveness and calls us to extend mercy and reconciliation to others.
It only refers to a physical object with no spiritual application.
It teaches that forgiveness is unnecessary.
It suggests holding grudges is acceptable.
questions.correctAnswer: The mercy seat represents God’s forgiveness and calls us to extend mercy and reconciliation to others.
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:34 mentions the mercy seat on the ark, symbolizing God's forgiveness, inspiring believers to practice mercy and reconciliation.

questions.question: How does the description of the tabernacle’s door hanging (Exodus 26:36-37) teach about the importance of welcoming others into fellowship?
options: The beautifully wrought hanging shows that the entrance to fellowship should be inviting and prepared with care.
It shows that the door should be closed to outsiders.
It teaches that fellowship is exclusive and unwelcoming.
It implies that the appearance of fellowship is unimportant.
questions.correctAnswer: The beautifully wrought hanging shows that the entrance to fellowship should be inviting and prepared with care.
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:36-37 describes the finely made door hanging, encouraging believers to be intentional and welcoming in church fellowship.

questions.question: In terms of stewardship, what does the use of costly materials like gold and silver in Exodus 26 teach about how believers should use their resources?
options: Believers should use their resources generously and wisely for God’s work, reflecting honor and gratitude.
Resources should be hoarded for personal gain.
Only minimal resources should be used to avoid expense.
Resources have no role in worship or service.
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should use their resources generously and wisely for God’s work, reflecting honor and gratitude.
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:6,19,29 shows gold and silver used to beautify the tabernacle, teaching stewardship that honors God through generosity.

questions.question: A husband and wife want to build a home that honors God. How can the example of the tabernacle’s careful construction in Exodus 26 guide their approach to family life?
options: By emphasizing careful planning, cooperation, and attention to detail in building a spiritual and physical household.
By suggesting a casual, unstructured approach to family life.
By focusing only on material wealth.
By ignoring each other’s roles and contributions.
questions.correctAnswer: By emphasizing careful planning, cooperation, and attention to detail in building a spiritual and physical household.
questions.explanation: Exodus 26’s detailed instructions (verses 15-25) illustrate the importance of order, cooperation, and commitment in building a dwelling for God, applicable to family life.

questions.question: How does the instruction to overlay the boards and bars with gold (Exodus 26:29) relate to cultivating gratitude and contentment in daily work?
options: It shows that even ordinary work can be made beautiful and valuable when done with a grateful heart.
It teaches that only gold work is valuable.
It suggests that work without gold is worthless.
It implies that appearance is more important than heart attitude.
questions.correctAnswer: It shows that even ordinary work can be made beautiful and valuable when done with a grateful heart.
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:29’s gold overlay symbolizes how gratitude can transform ordinary tasks into acts of worship and contentment.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The tabernacle’s vail was made of ______, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen with cherubims, symbolizing the separation between the holy place and the most holy.
options: blue
red
white
gold
questions.correctAnswer: blue
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:31 specifies the vail was made of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen with cherubims, marking the holy separation.

questions.question: What practical lesson about perseverance through trials can be drawn from the multiple layers of curtains and coverings described in Exodus 26?
options: Spiritual protection often involves multiple layers of God's grace, requiring patience and trust in His provision.
Trials should be removed immediately without enduring them.
One layer of protection is enough for all challenges.
Perseverance is unnecessary if troubles arise.
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual protection often involves multiple layers of God's grace, requiring patience and trust in His provision.
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:7-14 describes many layers of curtains and coverings, illustrating how God’s grace protects us through various stages, encouraging perseverance.

hard.title: Exodus Chapter 26 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Exodus Chapter 26.

questions.question: What materials are specified for the ten curtains of the tabernacle in Exodus 26?
options: Fine twined linen, blue, purple, and scarlet
Goats' hair and rams' skins dyed red
Badgers' skins and shittim wood
Gold and silver overlays
questions.correctAnswer: Fine twined linen, blue, purple, and scarlet
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:1 specifies that the ten curtains are made of fine twined linen and colored blue, purple, and scarlet.

questions.question: How many curtains of goats' hair are to be made for covering the tabernacle according to Exodus 26?
options: Eleven
Ten
Five
Seven
questions.correctAnswer: Eleven
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:7 states that eleven curtains of goats' hair are to be made to cover the tabernacle.

questions.question: The coupling of the curtains involves making loops on the edges. How many loops are made on each curtain edge for coupling?
options: Fifty loops
One hundred loops
Twenty-five loops
Thirty loops
questions.correctAnswer: Fifty loops
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:5 and 26:10 both specify that fifty loops are made on each curtain edge to couple them together.

questions.question: What is the significance of the cherubim embroidered on the curtains and veil in Exodus 26, considering later biblical typology?
options: They symbolize the presence and guardianship of God over the holy space
They represent angels who will physically guard the Israelites
They are purely decorative with no symbolic meaning
They symbolize the kings of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: They symbolize the presence and guardianship of God over the holy space
questions.explanation: The cherubim embroidered on the curtains and veil (Exodus 26:1 and 26:31) foreshadow the cherubim over the mercy seat in the Holy of Holies (Exodus 25:18-22), symbolizing God's presence and protection.

questions.question: What type of wood is specified for the boards of the tabernacle, and what is its significance in ancient Near Eastern context?
options: Shittim wood, known for its durability and rarity
Cedars of Lebanon, symbolizing strength
Oak wood, commonly used for construction
Acacia wood, symbolizing purity
questions.correctAnswer: Shittim wood, known for its durability and rarity
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:15 specifies shittim wood for the boards, a durable and valuable wood in the ancient Near East, symbolizing strength and incorruptibility.

questions.question: How many silver sockets are made for the twenty boards on each side of the tabernacle, and what does this detail suggest about the craftsmanship?
options: Forty sockets, two per board, indicating precise and stable construction
Twenty sockets, one per board, indicating simplicity
Sixty sockets, three per board, indicating extravagance
Thirty sockets, one and a half per board, indicating complexity
questions.correctAnswer: Forty sockets, two per board, indicating precise and stable construction
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:19 and 26:21 describe forty sockets of silver for the twenty boards on each side, two per board, reflecting careful and stable design.

questions.question: True or False: The middle bar for the boards of the tabernacle runs from end to end, providing structural integrity.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:28 states that the middle bar reaches from end to end, affirming its role in structural support.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the veil made of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen with cherubim as described in Exodus 26?
options: To separate the Holy Place from the Most Holy Place
To cover the ark of the covenant
To cover the entrance of the tabernacle
To be used as a garment for priests
questions.correctAnswer: To separate the Holy Place from the Most Holy Place
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:31-33 explains that the veil divides the tabernacle between the Holy Place and the Most Holy Place, guarding the sacred space containing the ark.

questions.question: How many pillars support the veil according to Exodus 26, and what materials are these pillars made of?
options: Four pillars of shittim wood overlaid with gold
Five pillars of cedar wood with bronze hooks
Three pillars of acacia wood painted blue
Six pillars of shittim wood with silver hooks
questions.correctAnswer: Four pillars of shittim wood overlaid with gold
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:32 describes four pillars made of shittim wood overlaid with gold supporting the veil.

questions.question: What coverings are placed over the curtains of the tabernacle and in what order as per Exodus 26?
options: Goats' hair curtains, then rams' skins dyed red, and finally badgers' skins on top
Fine linen curtains covered by goats' hair and then linen cloth
Rams' skins dyed red under goats' hair curtains
Badgers' skins covered by goats' hair and rams' skins
questions.correctAnswer: Goats' hair curtains, then rams' skins dyed red, and finally badgers' skins on top
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:7-14 describe the layering of eleven goats' hair curtains, then a covering of rams' skins dyed red, and finally badgers' skins as the outermost covering.

questions.question: According to the measurements given in Exodus 26, what are the length and breadth of one curtain made of fine twined linen?
options: Twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits broad
Thirty cubits long and five cubits broad
Twenty cubits long and three cubits broad
Thirty cubits long and four cubits broad
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits broad
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:2 specifies that each linen curtain is 28 cubits in length and 4 cubits in breadth.

questions.question: What is the significance of the gold taches used in coupling the curtains, considering the tabernacle's theological symbolism?
options: They symbolize the divine unity and holiness binding the tabernacle together
They are purely functional with no symbolic meaning
They represent the wealth of Israel
They are for decoration only
questions.correctAnswer: They symbolize the divine unity and holiness binding the tabernacle together
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:6 describes gold taches coupling the curtains into one tabernacle, symbolizing sacred unity and God's presence binding the holy space.

questions.question: How does the description of the tabernacle boards and their sockets in Exodus 26 relate to ancient Near Eastern architectural practices?
options: The use of silver sockets and tenoned boards reflects sophisticated joinery and precious material use typical of sacred spaces
The boards were loosely stacked without support, typical of nomadic tents
The construction used only wood without metal supports, unlike other cultures
The boards were made of stone rather than wood, reflecting Egyptian influence
questions.correctAnswer: The use of silver sockets and tenoned boards reflects sophisticated joinery and precious material use typical of sacred spaces
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:16-21 details boards with tenons set into silver sockets, indicating advanced woodworking and use of precious metals typical in ancient Near Eastern temple construction.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the hanging for the door of the tent described in Exodus 26:36-37, and how is it constructed?
options: Made of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen wrought with needlework, supported by five gold-overlaid pillars with brass sockets, it serves as the entrance covering
Made of goats' hair curtains with bronze supports, it serves as a protective shield
Made of simple linen cloth with wooden posts, it serves as a temporary door
Made of animal skins with silver hooks, it serves as a decorative banner
questions.correctAnswer: Made of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen wrought with needlework, supported by five gold-overlaid pillars with brass sockets, it serves as the entrance covering
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:36-37 explains the door hanging is finely made and supported by five gold-overlaid shittim wood pillars with brass sockets, marking the tabernacle entrance.

questions.question: In what way does the tabernacle's structure and materials in Exodus 26 prefigure New Testament themes of Christ and the church?
options: The veil separating holy places foreshadows Christ's atoning work dividing the sacred from the common
The gold taches represent the wealth of the early church
The goats' hair curtains symbolize sin and its permanence
The silver sockets symbolize the Old Testament priesthood exclusively
questions.correctAnswer: The veil separating holy places foreshadows Christ's atoning work dividing the sacred from the common
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:31-33 describes the veil dividing the sanctuary, which Hebrews 10:19-20 interprets as foreshadowing Christ's flesh that opens access to God.

theological.title: Exodus Chapter 26 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Exodus Chapter 26 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What materials are specified for making the curtains of the tabernacle according to Exodus 26?
options: Fine twined linen, blue, purple, scarlet with cherubims
Silk and gold embroidery
Cotton and dyed leather
Wool and linen mixed
questions.correctAnswer: Fine twined linen, blue, purple, scarlet with cherubims
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:1 commands the curtains to be made from fine twined linen with blue, purple, and scarlet colors, and with cherubims of cunning work. This reflects the holiness and beauty appropriate for God's dwelling, a theme consistent in the tabernacle symbolism (cf. Hebrews 9:2-5; Revelation 21:19-21; John 19:34-36).

questions.question: How many curtains of goats' hair were to be made for the covering of the tabernacle?
options: Eleven
Ten
Five
Seven
questions.correctAnswer: Eleven
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:7 specifies eleven curtains of goats' hair for the tabernacle covering. The goats' hair covering symbolized a protective layer, pointing typologically to Christ as the perfect covering for sin (cf. Leviticus 16:21-22; Isaiah 53:6; Romans 3:25).

questions.question: What was the length of each board made of shittim wood for the tabernacle's structure?
options: Ten cubits
Eight cubits
Five cubits
Twelve cubits
questions.correctAnswer: Ten cubits
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:16 states that each board shall be ten cubits in length. These boards formed the framework of the tabernacle, symbolizing the firm foundation of God's covenant with His people (cf. 1 Corinthians 3:11; Ephesians 2:20; Isaiah 28:16).

questions.question: How many silver sockets were made to support the twenty boards on the south side of the tabernacle?
options: Forty
Twenty
Thirty
Fifty
questions.correctAnswer: Forty
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:19 records forty silver sockets for the twenty boards on the south side, two under each board. Silver here symbolizes redemption and purity (cf. Exodus 30:11-16; Psalm 12:6; 1 Peter 1:18-19).

questions.question: What was the purpose of making fifty loops and fifty taches on the curtains as described in Exodus 26?
options: To couple the curtains together forming one tabernacle
To decorate the curtains with gold
To hang the curtains on poles
To separate the holy and most holy places
questions.correctAnswer: To couple the curtains together forming one tabernacle
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:5-6 explains that fifty loops and fifty taches were made to couple the curtains together, making the tabernacle one unified structure. This unity points to the comprehensive nature of God's dwelling among His people and His covenant relationship (cf. John 17:21; Ephesians 2:14-16; Colossians 1:19-20).

questions.question: What materials were used for the vail that divided the holy place and the most holy place?
options: Blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen with cherubims
Goats' hair and badgers' skins
Shittim wood overlaid with gold
Rams' skins dyed red
questions.correctAnswer: Blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen with cherubims
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:31 specifies the vail to be made of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen with cherubims. This vail symbolized the separation between God’s holiness and sinful humanity, a theme fulfilled in Christ's atoning work (cf. Hebrews 9:3-8; Matthew 27:51; 2 Corinthians 3:14-16).

questions.question: How many boards were made for each side of the tabernacle on the north and south sides?
options: Twenty
Ten
Thirty
Fifteen
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:18 and 26:20 mention twenty boards on both the south and north sides of the tabernacle. This symmetry reflects the order and completeness of God's dwelling place (cf. 1 Kings 6:15-22; Revelation 21:16).

questions.question: What was the significance of overlaying the boards and bars with gold?
options: Gold represents God's purity, holiness, and divine presence
Gold was used for durability and strength
Gold symbolized wealth and earthly kingship
Gold was required for trade purposes
questions.correctAnswer: Gold represents God's purity, holiness, and divine presence
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:29 describes overlaying boards and bars with gold, symbolizing God's purity, holiness, and presence among His people (cf. Exodus 25:11; Psalm 45:9; Revelation 21:18-21). Gold in the tabernacle points to the divine glory that fills the sanctuary (cf. 1 Kings 8:10-11).

questions.question: What was the purpose of the mercy seat placed upon the ark of the testimony in the most holy place?
options: It was the place where God’s presence dwelt and where atonement was made
It was a throne for the high priest
It was a storage for sacred scrolls
It was a decorative cover for the ark
questions.correctAnswer: It was the place where God’s presence dwelt and where atonement was made
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:34 states the mercy seat was placed upon the ark in the most holy place. The mercy seat was the meeting point between God and man, signifying atonement and forgiveness (cf. Leviticus 16:14-15; Hebrews 9:5; Romans 3:25). It prefigures Christ as the propitiation for our sins (1 John 2:2).

questions.question: Which items were placed outside the vail in the holy place of the tabernacle?
options: The table and the candlestick
The ark of the testimony and the mercy seat
The altar of burnt offering and the laver
The goats' hair curtains and rams' skins
questions.correctAnswer: The table and the candlestick
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:35 describes the table and the candlestick placed outside the vail in the holy place. These represent God’s provision and light in the believer’s life (cf. Leviticus 24:5-6; John 8:12; Matthew 6:11).

questions.question: How many pillars were made for the hanging of the door of the tabernacle tent?
options: Five
Four
Six
Seven
questions.correctAnswer: Five
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:37 specifies five pillars of shittim wood overlaid with gold and their hooks of gold for the door hanging. This shows the care and dignity in the entrance to God's presence (cf. Exodus 27:16; John 10:9; Revelation 3:20).

questions.question: What was the covering above the rams' skins dyed red on the tabernacle?
options: Badgers' skins
Goats' hair
Fine twined linen
Scarlet cloth
questions.correctAnswer: Badgers' skins
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:14 states the covering above the rams' skins dyed red was of badgers' skins. This outermost covering symbolizes protection and separation from the world, pointing to Christ’s atoning blood and ultimate covering (cf. Leviticus 14:4-7; Hebrews 9:12).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the cherubims embroidered on the tabernacle curtains and vail?
options: They symbolize God’s heavenly throne and divine presence
They represent angels guarding the entrance
They are decorative motifs with no spiritual meaning
They depict the tribes of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: They symbolize God’s heavenly throne and divine presence
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:1 and 26:31 mention cherubims embroidered on the curtains and vail, symbolizing God’s throne and presence (cf. Ezekiel 1:10; Psalm 80:1; Hebrews 9:5). This shows the tabernacle as a microcosm of heaven where God dwells among His people.

questions.question: What does the doubling of the sixth curtain in the goats' hair covering symbolize in biblical theology?
options: Extra protection and completeness in God’s covenant dwelling
An error in measurement corrected by doubling
A separation between holy and common areas
A symbolic representation of the two tablets of the covenant
questions.correctAnswer: Extra protection and completeness in God’s covenant dwelling
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:9 describes doubling the sixth curtain in the goats' hair covering, emphasizing protection and completeness. This reflects God's thorough provision for His dwelling among His people, paralleling Christ as the perfect protection of the believer (cf. Psalm 91:4; John 10:28-29; Ephesians 1:3-14).

questions.question: According to Exodus 26, how were the two corner boards connected at the tabernacle's west side?
options: Coupled together beneath and above unto one ring
Nailed with iron nails
Joined by leather straps
Left unattached for flexibility
questions.correctAnswer: Coupled together beneath and above unto one ring
questions.explanation: Exodus 26:24 explains the two corner boards were coupled together beneath and above unto one ring, symbolizing unity and strength in God's holy dwelling (cf. Ecclesiastes 4:12; Ephesians 4:16). This unity prefigures the church as one body in Christ (1 Corinthians 12:12-27).
